title: Why may epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) induce myopathy in man? Report of a case and literature review.
abst: A case of necrotizing myopathy due to a short epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) treatment in a 72 year-old patient with subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) is described. Pathogenetic hypotheses are discussed.
title_plus_abst: Why may epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) induce myopathy in man? Report of a case and literature review. A case of necrotizing myopathy due to a short epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) treatment in a 72 year-old patient with subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) is described. Pathogenetic hypotheses are discussed.
split_sentence: Why may epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) induce myopathy in man? Report of a case and literature review.
A case of necrotizing myopathy due to a short epsilon-aminocaproic acid (EACA) treatment in a 72 year-old patient with subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) is described.
